DOC.brief_summary: Aerobic exercise produce increase cardiorespiratory fitness ( CF ) , constitute protective factor cardiovascular disease all-cause mortality . Therefore , aerobic exercise key strategy promote cardiovascular . There evidence aerobic high intensity interval training may lead great increase CF compare continuous moderate-intensity training . The main objective study examine effect aerobic high intensity train program versus continuous moderate intensity train program CF men 18 44 year .
DOC.brief_title: Interval Versus Continuous Training Healthy Adults
DOC.detailed_description: Forty-four individual randomly assign one two aerobic train program treadmill . Both group perform three time week eight-weeks ( alternate day ) . Half run 40 minute continuous exercise intensity 65-75 % maximum heart rate , remain 22 complete 21.5 minute interval exercise intensity 90-95 % maximum heart rate , recoveries 50-55 % maximum heart rate . After session group complete eight strength exercise mainly include large muscle group two set 8-12 repetition intensity equivalent 60-70 % one repetition maximum ( control perceive effort ) . Rest set keep 60 90 second . All participant evaluate start completion intervention maximal oxygen consumption , blood pressure , waist circumference , BMI , body composition , step per week .
DOC.criteria: Perform aerobic exercise maximum 3 session per week Currently participate aerobic high intensity train program Smoker History cardiovascular disease History coronary heart disease Arrhythmias Heart failure/insufficiency Hypertension Diabetes Under medical treatment anticoagulant , betablockers , calcium antagonist , bronchodilator , and/or steroid Psychological , neuromotor and/or osteomuscular condition may affect participation exercise program .
